channel.title: Hexo on bobh's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Hexo on bobh's blog

item.title: Test
item.description: Forward Progress Some atomic operations may fail spuriously due to interference from other threads. Implementations are encouraged, but not required, to prevent spurious failures from indefinitely delaying progress. Block: Wait for a condition to be satisfied before continuing execution. Blocking library functions are considered to continuously execute execution steps while waiting for their condition to be satisfied. Thus, blocking makes progress. Forward progress guarantees that something observable should eventually happens.
